title: Ticket #4850: Collector ad is dropped for personal HTCondor
description:
Ever since we added COLLECTOR_USES_SHARED_PORT, the collector does not listen on a UDP port for personal HTCondor installs (which use arbitrary ports) if USE_SHARED_PORT=true.

This is because, when shared port is in use and there's no specific port requested, no additional UDP/TCP socket pair is requested. It's assumed, in this case, the only way to find a daemon is through a collector or $COLLECTOR_ADDRESS_FILE. It works in all cases except for updating collector ads - which forcibly disable TCP updates.

In the case of a UPDATE_COLLECTOR_AD, we should check if the sinful has noUDP and act accordingly:

  1. Allow TCP updates if this is not a daemon
  2. Allow TCP updates if we are not updating our own command socket
  3. Otherwise, utilize the fact we always have a UDP port for the super-user socket - send the update through that!
remarks:
2015-Jan-29 13:42:05 by tlmiller:
I don't like the precedent of sending routine traffic to the super-user socket, but I do like that this patch corrects a bug where a collector could not advertise itself to any other collector which did not have a(n accessible) UDP command port.

I'm looking into solving this by removing self-advertisements from the network code path entirely.

2015-Jan-29 16:32:33 by tlmiller:
Proposed new patch / approach in commit on branch. Patch could me modified to also check if it's sending to the world collector and force UDP-only, but we don't think that's actually necessary.

2015-Feb-09 14:26:38 by tlmiller:
Brian wonders what AuthenticatedIdentity will be when the collector self-inserts. The correct answer may be "who cares?"
